physicalDescription.extent: File papers are arranged chronologically. There are a few file notes on folio 7.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the back cover with 8; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is also present in parallel between ff 2-6; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled, and are located in the same position as the main sequence.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence in 1933 about the monthly allowance of Shaikh Khalifah bin Muhammad al Khalifah.The file begins with a letter from Gordon Percy Loch, Political Agent in Bahrain, to Charles Dalrymple Belgrave, Advisor to the Bahrain Government, describing a visit from Shaikh Khalifah with a request to intercede with Shaikh Hamad bin Isa, Ruler of Bahrain, over the reduction of Shaikh Khalifah's monthly allowance. The letter describes how they also discussed the possibility of selling off some date gardens to the Bahrain Government.This is followed in the correspondence by a petition (in the original Arabic, followed by English translation) from Shaikh Khalifah to the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf.
